newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * Floods in western Romania close to the border with Hungary affected scores of households. A commission is evaluating the damage caused by the heavy rainshowers.
* Coalminers in the Jiu Valley continue their strike over pay demands.
A miners' delegation is expected to meet Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea in Bucharest later today.
* Workers of the state-run Roman SA protest over the company's restructuring and privatisation programme.

* The National Peasant Party (PNT-CD) hopes that the support shown by Western countries for Romania to join NATO in its first wave of eastward expansion will have positiv impact in Washington, PNT-CD general secretary Radu Vasile told a news conference.
His remark followed a decision by the U.S. administration last week to invite only three ex-communist countries -- Poland, Hungary and the Czech Republic -- to join NATO.
